Rulings.Base:
1. If you have no Tuners in your Deck, you cannot activate the first effect.
2. If you do not have at least 5 cards in your Deck you cannot activate the first effect.
3. If you reveal no Tuner monsters with the first effect, "Shooting Star Dragon" cannot attack that turn.
4. This card's first effect sets its maximum number of attacks during EACH Battle Phase.
5. You still reveal the top 5 cards of your Deck even if "Shooting Star Dragon" isn't on the field when the first effect resolves. You also still reveal if you have less than 4 cards in your Deck when the effect resolves.
6. The third effect targets the attacking monster.
7. If your opponent's attack is not negated by the third effect, "Shooting Star Dragon" is still Special Summoned in the End Phase.
8. If your opponent controls your "Shooting Star Dragon" and activates its third effect, it is Special Summoned to your side of the field in the End Phase.
9. The effect to Special Summon "Shooting Star Dragon" in the End Phase activates only once per End Phase. If it is negated, it doesn't activate again during that same End Phase.

PSCT.Base:
1 Tuner Synchro Monster + "Stardust Dragon"
Once per turn: You can excavate the top 5 cards of your Deck, shuffle them back in, also this card's maximum number of attacks per Battle Phase this turn equals the number of Tuner monsters excavated. Once per turn, during either player's turn, when a card or effect is activated that would destroy a card(s) on the field: You can negate the effect, and if you do, destroy it. Once per turn, when an opponent's monster declares an attack: You can target the attacking monster; banish this card, and if you do, negate that attack. During the next End Phase: Special Summon this card banished by this effect.
